duties_responsibilities.duty: Build, inspect, and repair rail cars according to safety and regulatory standards.
Weld and paint rail cars and locomotives, and fabricate components as needed.
Inspect and analyze rail car components for compliance with safety standards and identify corrective actions.
Operate heavy equipment such as cranes and forklifts for car movement and repair.
Perform airbrake tests and apply necessary end-of-train devices to ensure safe operation.
Maintain tie-down devices, interior load restraining equipment, and other special equipment on railroad cars.
Rerail cars and locomotives and conduct wreck service work on the railroad as needed.
Utilize computer systems to obtain information on car characteristics, destination, repair records, and more.
Perform miscellaneous activities and responsibilities as assigned by the manager.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma/GED with one year of mechanical work experience or training. Carman apprenticeship is preferred.
